title: Monarchy of Belgium
summary: Belgium is a constitutional, hereditary, and popular monarchy. The monarch is titled king or queen of the Belgians (Dutch: Koning(in) der Belgen, French: Roi / Reine des Belges, German: KÃ¶nig(in) der Belgier) and serves as the country's head of state. There have been seven kings since independence in 1830.
